content: system as the ESM, several entries in the CONFIG DATADVH file set defaults for the DirMaint RACF connector support, which provides automatic communication with RACF. 10.4.1 Configuring RACF-Connector RACF can coexist with the DirMaint product installed. However, to avoid dual maintenance of password processing (and other RACF functions), complete the following steps: 1. Use the DirMaint supplied sample file CONFIGRC SAMPDVH. You must copy this file to the 7VMDIR20 11F disk as CONFIGRC DATADVH. 2. If RACF administration is centralized, you must give the DIRMAINT user ID the RACF attribute SPECIAL. If RACF administration is decentralized, you must give the DIRMAINT user ID RACF group-SPECIAL attribute. 3. If you want to record DirMaint activity in RACF SMF records, enable ESM_LOG_RECORDING_EXIT. For this change to take effect, run the DIRM RLDDATA command. 4. You must also authorize the DirMaint service machines DIRMAINT, DATAMOVE, and DIRMSAT to use the RACROUTE interface. Note: Only
